story:
Nodoka - Organic Japanese Tea Powder

Nodoka provides high quality organic Japanese green tea directly from Japan's premier organic tea farms. Nodoka means calm and peaceful in Japanese. The traditional Japanese tea ceremony is a symbol of peace, harmony and happiness. 

            ​

   

My story 

I was born and raised in Tokyo Japan but I lived in NY for several years working to promote Japanese products to an international audience and manage Japanese cultural events. Through these experiences, I have developed a deep appreciation of culture and small, local producers who put passion into their products.

Despite the popularity of Matcha and Japanese green tea, I couldn't find what I knew as good Matcha green tea in New York. I soon discovered that most green tea there was not made with leaves from Japan, despite being labeled, “Japanese Green Tea.” From this I set off on a journey to discover why this is, and in the process, I rediscovered the Japanese tea farm. 

               

While searching and meeting with dozens of organic tea farmers, I became fascinated by the world of organic green tea in Japan. These encounters guided me through  a journey to understand the cultural and philosophical importance of organic green tea. I also learned the immense of the challenges―both natural and economic―facing organic tea farmers in Japan.

 

Japan's traditional tea makers are becoming more and more at risk.

Despite its vast popularity, 98% of tea grown in Japan stays in Japan, with only 2% being sold in other countries. 

                               

In the past few years, the trend has moved away from small tea producers and ornate ceremonies towards bottled green tea alternatives―often made from sub-par product.

According to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, there were 59,248 tea farmers in 1995. In 2015, there were only 29,624 tea farmers. 

               

With the average age of tea farmers being over 60 and little incentive for a younger generation to take over, the traditional Japanese tea trade is at a critical juncture.These farmers cannot speak English. They cannot use any technology like Skype or email. 

　　　

 

Although they have a superior product with a long history, but they just aren’t able to sell it outside of the country.

 

Bringing the farmers to market

During my journey, I met Yoshimitsu Masuda, and fell in love with his farm, where I found a tea that really spoke to me. 

            

 Under the watchful eye of Mount Fuji in Japan’s Shizuoka Prefecture, the Masuda family has been delicately tending to their organic tea farm for generations. Before ‘organic’ farming became a trend, the family’s patriarch, Yoshimitsu Masuda, took a stand against the chemical companies, choosing to go through the long process of converting all his tea fields to organic cultivation. 

            

When they find harmful insects on their crop, Yoshimitsu and his family remove them by hand, one-by-one.

Now the entire his tea farm and tea manufacturing facility have received JAS and USDA organic certification, which is so rare that only 3% of tea grown in Japan is certified as organic.

            

 

OUR MISSION 

After my encounter with Yoshimitsu, I started my new company, Nodoka, to bring these premium products to the rest of the world. I feel very strongly that, if only they could gain access to the international market, things would change for the better for these farmers and their communities.

Not only is organic green tea delicious and nutritious, but it also offers a more stable source of income for local small family-owned organic tea growers in Japan. I believe it is very important that we appreciate the story behind the things we use, who made it, and how it was made.

                    

NODOKA'S TRADITIONAL JAPANESE TEA POWDER 

Every Nodoka’s tea contains essential plant nutrients that will energize your body, improve mental clarity, reduce stress, and promote vibrant health.

      

  

      

JAS and USDA certified organic.

No preservatives. Non-GMO. Gluten-free. Vegan.

         

Powdered, delicious, incredibly versatile.

Nodoka is tea powder. Powdered tea doesn’t take long to prepare. Just mix it in water and enjoy.

              

About 70% of the nutrition is lost when you make tea from leaves. By drinking green tea as a powder, you receive the benefits of the whole leaf instead of only the water-soluble parts.   

                    

This powerful tea powder mixes well into everything from baked goods and smoothies,to lattes and blends.   

 

                

　

 

AWARD

A finalist in the World Tea Expo Awards for the 2016 New Product in Tea as an Ingredient category    

                  

           

 

NODOKA IN THE PRESS

CREW STORY : How Nodoka built a brand by helping save traditional Japanese tea makers

http://stories.crew.co/archive/nodoka/

 

WORLD TEA NEWS : Reviving Japan’s Tea Lands

http://worldteanews.com/news/world-tea-communit...

 

TECH IN ASIA : 5 startups that caught our eye at Tech in Asia Tokyo 2016

https://www.techinasia.com/5-startups-caught-ey...

　　　

 

Original Pouch and Cap  

         

 

Risks & Challenges

We've built relationships with tea farmers. We are confident that we will procure and personalize the highest-quality teas for you.

Making tea is a profession with many nuances as is tasting tea, so trying to reproduce the exact same flavor profiles as our first flush is a challenge. We are taking all the necessary measures to ensure that the quality is the same. 

As backers, you will always be kept up to date with the latest developments, and you will know exactly what we know, as soon as we know it.

We also anticipate possible improvements to future products, if we receive convincing feedback from our backers.

 

Please Share Our Message 

We hope you'll join us and are thankful for your pledges. In addition to pledging, sharing this page in social media is very valuable as well!

Nodoka website: https://www.nodokatea.com


Thanks for your Support!

story:
Our Dream

My name is Gatesire Saad, and I am the founder of Scoops, the first to be Specialty Ice Cream Shop in Musanze Rwanda. This is the story of my dream to start an ice cream shop in our town: Musanze, Rwanda. 

Everyone loves ice cream. It’s a common thing that connects many people from all over the word. Eating ice cream is an experience of happiness that families and kids know very well. Its not a common product in Rwanda, but I want to bring this good thing to my community. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal for this campaign is to raise $10,000. We already have our equipment for production and these funds will be used for securing and developing a location, as well as buying furniture and supplies for the shop. Getting these funds will let us have enough money for rent and for our first few months of operating. After an initial private fundraising campaign, we have already purchased a commercial grade ice cream machine and cone maker, the most important tools for our shop (featured in our campaign video above). Now we need to create the space where those machines will do their magic!

Our perks for our supporters:

We've got a great range of Scoop branded products planned as a thank you to our supporters. These include vouchers for free ice cream, stickers, hats, ice-cream bowls, t-shirts, and custom ice cream scoops. 

 

The Impact

Apart from creating smiling faces Scoop will contribute to the development of our community in serval ways:

  • Providing job training and employment for venerable youth in our community. 
  • Help to create an incubator that will teach, empower, and and motivate young entrepreneurs. 
  • Provide a great community space for our town 

Risks & Challenges

Its not a common product in our town, but I believe that once people try it we can build an ice-cream culture. We have tested our product and given out samples. The responses have been overwhelmingly positive! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell as many people as possible and share our Indiegogo page with your network!

story:
I have been baking my whole life. Growing up in a southern family you just grow up in the kitchen. Cooking is a skill that you can never master but you can always improve and it's an art. Art is another passion, I was in the art honors society and got to travel to Italy to view the famous paintings and sculptures up close. Passions got set to the back burner during my 20s when I used skills to design web sites and work various IT positions. We decided last year it was time to combine my passions and start creating our life around them. Smash the Pastriarchy was born!

I use my own recipes that I create after weeks (or sometimes months) of trials. I know how to combine flavors in different and creative ways. We are doing great as a small business and we are even able to give away a cake every month to our community. I understand that custom cakes are not a luxury all families can afford and it brings me joy to spread happiness around the community.  

This campaign will be used in the following ways:

-To file a DBA and obtain an EIN 

-To file a trademark on my business name

-To obtain a vehicle to do deliveries

-To create merchandise such as bumper stickers, car magnets, etc to market and effectively advertise my business, 

-To obtain the Web domain and set up a site 

Anything extra will be put towards the business for tools and pans as we are operating on bare minimum! 

Thank you again, this will help us and allow us to continue to grow and give back to the community!

story:
My name is Lucia Echevarria. I study Administration at USIL University.  I am in the last semester.I'm quite interested in volunteering helping people to improve human quality of life, I also belive that entrepreneurship and social responsibility will contibuite to achieve this goal.

 last year I had the idea of make my own entrepreneurship, which consisted in create a food store to sell  native products from different regions of my country. I was looking for revaluate our products and revaluate the work of small and medium-sized farmers, as well as to improve people nutrition.

When I finished my business plan, I realized that in order to put the store into operation, it would require a lot of investment, which I didn't have. That is why I decided to bring one product for the Andes to sell in Lima City. That product was the “imilla potato” that is a variety of Peruvian native potato that grows in Puno, 3800 meters above sea level. They are sown and harvested without chemicals or pesticides.

The potato sale was a success, selling 100 kilos in two days. The persons in Lima had never tried that variety of potato. In Peru we have more than 3000 varieties of potatoes but in Lima we only eat 4 or 5 types of potaoes.  Which motivated me to continue bringing new products. However, I don't have the money to bring more

Actually I take the order through whatssapp and I deliver potatoes by moto delivery. I use special bags made of jute (as seen in the photo). Also  I take take care of the environment. I have 40 clients that buy these delicious potatoes every month. My dream is to increase the quantity of products, until I can set up our own store. I know I have a long way, so I go step by step.

The Impact

Puno is in southeasterm Peru between the shore of Lake Titicaca and Andes Mountains. Also Puno is the fisrt major hub in the constant migration of indigenous people of the Andes to the larger cities of Peru. Most of them come from agricultural communities seeking better opportunities for education and employment.

  • The impact of this Project is to make known the imilla potato and other different types of peruvian native products.

  • I Also seek to be a intermediary between small farmers and the people looking to consume organic foods. So they can access to Lima market and increase the sell of their agricultural products.

What we need?

Thanks to your collaboration, we will be able to achieve some of our goals this year as:

  • Bring two new native products from Puno such as "multicolored quinoa" (Andean grain) and yacon (fruit)

  • Increase the amount of Kilos from 100 to 200.

  • Attend more customers by delivery, today we serve 40

  • Distribute the products every 15 days, today is once a month.

What you get?

Each person will get a personal thanks (Virtual High Five). Every support counts and I will be grateful! Also I will greeting when update facebook page.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tell all your friends and families!

story:
Hello everyone! Thanks for stopping by and checking out our campaign. In advance, we thank you for your time and consideration.

First off, let us introduce ourselves.
ELDERBREW is: Chris Bryant, Michael Peck and Daniel Rhoton, three guys passionate about craft beer and the communal aspect in which it thrives. Since 2013, we have been developing award-winning beers in Northeast Tennessee as home brewers, and in 2015, we began our journey to cross the threshold and start brewing professionally. ELDERBREW will develop and operate a Brew Pub and Nano Brewery in Historic Downtown Bristol, TN which will engage craft beer enthusiasts, artisans, and home brewers through a variety of services and experiences.  Our tap room will cater to a wide demographic attracting the young professional, craft beer advocates, and the “seasoned” craft beer connoisseur.

We have set our goal at $10,000 in order to purchase our 3bbl (barrel) system. A system this size will allow us to brew enough to keep the taps full, yet is small enough to allow us to introduce new beers more often, rather sitting on a bazillion gallons. We want to keep things fresh, interesting, and ever changing. If we do not meet this goal, we have already planned to cover the difference. After all, we do need to make beer don’t we? Of course we do. And we can’t wait!

So what’s in it for you?
Great question. First off, if you reside in Northeast TN, you’ll have a new brewery to visit, and if you’re a Bristol resident, you’ll now have your very own Brewery located downtown on 6th Street. Some may be saying, “I don’t live anywhere near you guys, but I hear Bristol is a pretty happening town, maybe one day I’ll visit.” Cool, come on! We’ll have a cold one waiting for you.

So here’s the Perks:

Tier 1 Backer - $10
Elderbrew Sticker and Commemorative Pint Glass Combo.

Tier 2 Backer - $25
Elderbrew Sticker, Commemorative Pint Glass, and Elderbrew Shirt.

Tier 3 Backer - $50
Elderbrew Sticker, Commemorative Pint Glass, and Elderbrew Shirt, plus 2 free pours of Elderbrew (your choice).

Tier 4 Backer or Boss Mode Backer - $100
Elderbrew Sticker, Commemorative Pint Glass, and Elderbrew Shirt, plus 2 free pours of Elderbrew AND admission to a Private “Backer Only” Shin Dig at Elderbrew HQ!

Tier 5 Backer or shall we say Beast Mode Backer - $250
Elderbrew Sticker, Commemorative Pint Glass, and Elderbrew Shirt, plus 2 free pours of Elderbrew AND admission to a Private “Backer Only” Shin Dig at Elderbrew HQ, plus a one off Elderbrew 20 oz. Ceramic Mug (bring it in and you’ll get 4 more ounces of delicious Elderbrew for the price of 16oz!

Tier 6 Backer or straight up Overlord Status - $500
Elderbrew Sticker, Commemorative Pint Glass, and Elderbrew Shirt, plus 2 free pours of Elderbrew AND admission to a Private “Backer Only” Shin Dig at Elderbrew HQ, plus a one off Elderbrew 20 oz. Ceramic Mug (bring it in and you’ll get 4 more ounces of delicious Elderbrew for the price of 16oz!
Oh, and guess what, you get to come brew your favorite style of beer with us, which we name in your honor. Just imagine how cool it will be to come in and order a Dale Cooper Coffee Porter? It’d be a lot cooler if your name was Dale Cooper, but we’re confident your name is just as cool!

The impact of ELDERBREW in downtown Bristol will be felt almost immediately. As we’ve mentioned, there currently is not a craft brewer located on the Tennessee side of Bristol. On the Virginia side, there currently are two. However, our goal is to fill a void that is currently present by bringing Bristol new and exciting styles, improving on current styles, educating and engaging the public, and bringing all the breweries together to create a community often found in more saturated markets.

Now, we know there is a risk involved in this, and we have factored that in from the start. Our goals are to engage with the community through various aspects of stewardship, elevate the palettes of craft beer consumers already present, and make Bristol a Craft Beer destination. It has the potential, it has the people, and its music history is nationally known. Whether you live here or not, we are eager to meet you and share our craft with you.

Again, thank you for your time, consideration and support. If you can’t support us with your hard earned cash, NO SWEAT! We truly appreciate you for more than that. However, if you could do us a solid by sharing this with your friends, family, the guy at work that only drinks IPA, whoever… please do. That means a lot and we’ve got something special for you too. Just stop by Elderbrew at 24, 6th Street Bristol Tennessee, and mention this campaign.

Ceramic Mug (bring it in and you’ll get 4 more ounces of delicious Elderbrew for the price of 16oz!Oh, and guess what, you get to come brew your favorite style of beer with us, which we name in your honor. Just imagine how cool it will be to come in and order a Dale Cooper Coffee Porter? It’d be a lot cooler if your name was Dale Cooper, but we’re confident your name is just as cool!The impact of ELDERBREW in downtown Bristol will be felt almost immediately. As we’ve mentioned, there currently is not a craft brewer located on the Tennessee side of Bristol. On the Virginia side, there currently are two. However, our goal is to fill a void that is currently present by bringing Bristol new and exciting styles, improving on current styles, educating and engaging the public, and bringing all the breweries together to create a community often found in more saturated markets.Now, we know there is a risk involved in this, and we have factored that in from the start. Our goals are to engage with the community through various aspects of stewardship, elevate the palettes of craft beer consumers already present, and make Bristol a Craft Beer destination. It has the potential, it has the people, and its music history is nationally known. Whether you live here or not, we are eager to meet you and share our craft with you.Again, thank you for your time, consideration and support. If you can’t support us with your hard earned cash, NO SWEAT! We truly appreciate you for more than that. However, if you could do us a solid by sharing this with your friends, family, the guy at work that only drinks IPA, whoever… please do. That means a lot and we’ve got something special for you too. Just stop by Elderbrew at 24, 6th Street Bristol Tennessee, and mention this campaign.

story:
The SQURLBox
 
The SQURLBox is a patent-pending premium meal-prep container, used to keep food hot for up to 6hrs. and cold for 24hrs. SQURL, LLC leverages the advantages of the Computer Animated Design (CAD) process, to engineer an efficient temperature maintained meal-prep system. The SQURLstorage container is made for safe food storage. Being dishwasher, microwave, and refrigerator safe, the SQURLstorage container is made for easy last-mile food preparations. The double-insulated, water and ozone resistant SQURLshell is made for last-mile travel.  Keeping your meals in an isolated environment, for the safest conditions from AtoZ. The SQURLBox not only defensively protect against heat loss, it actively maintains heat with our added SQURLpak, which is a microwavable, non-toxic gel pack, and SQURLice, which is our efficiently designed icepack.
 

 
 

 

 

 


DESIGNED, CREATED, and MADE IN AMERICA

 

 
 

THE TEAM

Mark Harrison

Mark is an eCommerce consultant and philanthropist.

Joyce Ivory

Joyce is a PH.D. candidate in organizational leadership and business operations subject matter expert

Micheal Ivory

Micheal is an innovative inventor, visionary, and CEO of SQURL, LLC.

 

 

You can also help by sharing our campaign in your circles.

story:
Short Summary

On November 11th 2018, we launched Tippsy Sake, the largest online sake platform in the US.

My name is Genki. I moved to the US in 2009 and have been working for the largest Japanese Food/Sake importer in the US. Having seen the gap between the growing interest in craft sake and the lack of availability in selection and knowledge for majority of consumers, I founded Tippsy to take the initiatives to promote this Japanese "mystery drink" and expand the potential to make it a whole new alcohol category like wine. 

https://tippsysake.com/

Why Crowdfunding Campaign?

We want to expand our business to offer a monthly subscription service that will feature three small bottles so curious drinkers can explore new flavors and food pairings to find the brand they truly love! We need at least 100 subscribers to secure inventory and prepare operations.

Why we do what we do

Although many people have tried sake at sushi restaurants, high-quality sakes don’t usually reach consumers due to the buyer’s lack of knowledge, strict regulations in alcohol distribution, and the complex supply chain that involves a lot of middle margins. In fact, many of the products that actually reach restaurants or retail stores are cheaper, mass-produced items made in California with US-made rice. 

Sake has gained a lot of interest, but the jargon can be intimidating. Without a fair amount of knowledge, most consumers find it difficult to choose a bottle that fits their taste preferences and end up missing out on the versatile flavors of authentic, premium sake that matches all types of cuisine other than just sushi. 

 

Simplifying the Experience

We’ve decoded the labels and created taste metrics for almost 200 sake so you can easily try new flavors and food pairings to enhance your dining experience! With our unique and easy-to-understand visual metrics, we’re taking the guesswork out of selecting sake so that you’ll know what you’re drinking and can easily pair it with your favorite dishes. 

 

Streamlining the Supply Chain

Our operations will be based in California where most of the ocean containers carrying sake first arrive to the US. We’re cutting out the middlemen to keep the supply chain as short and simple as possible so that you can enjoy sake fresher than you would normally drink, and at reasonable prices. (less than half of what you’d normally pay at restaurants)

Use of Funds

We will use the fund mainly to prepare for monthly subscription box. Although we set the goal of the project to $5K to just cover base costs, we will need approximately $10K to establish smooth operations because we are just starting up.

$2000 for inventory - It takes approximately 3 months to receive shipments from Japan. This portion of funds will be used to secure inventory for the confirmed number of club members to get our service off the ground.

$5000 for Shipping Materials ( box, inserts, cutting dies and print plate) - We’ve perfected our custom-made packaging to ensure maximum durability of glass sake bottles for nationwide delivery. Upfront investment will be required to secure these shipping materials.

$3000 for Warehouse Space - We’re currently subleasing a corner of a small warehouse. A larger space is necessary for more efficient operations and the shortest turnaround for our orders.

Reward Levels

  • $10: Thank-you card
  • $30: Sake Glass x 2 & Sticker & Thank-you card
  • $49: One Membership 
  • $90: Holiday Gift Voucher($100)
  • $100: Just want to support Tippsy
  • $140: 3-month Membership & Glass
  • $180: Holiday Gift Voucher($200)
  • $270: 6-month Membership & Glass x 2
  • $350: Holiday Gift Voucher($400)
  • $1000: Holiday Special Gift Box
  • $3,000: Invite to Professional Sake Tasting Event
  • $10,000: Invite to Japan Brewery Trip

*Alcohol Shipping in US only (except for AK, AR, HI, KY, MS and UT )

Risks & Challenges

In case of failure to send the reward, we will give a full refund. We acknowledge that because of the regulations and our shipping capabilities we may not be able to the ship to following states (AK, AR, HI, KY, MS and UT) or overseas. We recommend using your work address for delivery as alcohol shipments require adult signature upon delivery to avoid the carrier returning your order.

Founder

From Nagoya, Japan. 9 years of experience in Japanese food marketing in Los Angeles, New York and Honolulu. University of Southern California, Marshall MBA 2018.

story:
When added to 12-16 oz of water, Jele hydration tablets create a great-tasting, all-natural sports drink, giving kids more of what they need (electrolytes and vitamins) and less of what they don’t (SUGAR!). Proper hydration supports the immune system and promotes healthy organ and muscle function.

Jele tablets only have 1g of sugar. The Recommended Daily Allowance of sugar for kids under 18 in the US is 25mg. Most of the big sports drink brands have up to 36g of sugar in one 20 oz serving - that's 44% more than kids are supposed to get in an entire day! 

Jele contains vitamin C to help support healthy immune systems, Calcium, to help support healthy bone growth, and vitamin D, which helps support both immune system functioning and healthy bone growth. Jele also has the key electrolytes Magnesium and Potassium to help support proper muscle and nerve functioning.

Compare our main ingredients to the big sports drink brands:

 

Jele tablets are all natural, vegan, gluten free and are made in an NSF GMP Registered development lab and production facility right here in the US!

We enlisted 35 kids, aged 5-16, to taste the different prototypes during product development and give us detailed feedback on overall taste, color, fruit flavor and sweetness levels. We used that feedback to arrive at the final formulations for each of our four flavors and kids love the taste!

In addition to providing vitamins and key electrolytes, Jele tabs also reduce the impact plastic is having on our lives. The carbon footprint of the plastic bottles from the big sports drink brands is enormous. In addition to the raw materials and energy used to make the bottles, a huge impact is made with the transport of the bottles from their source, to the bottling facility, to the stores where you buy them and finally, to your home. Only 25% of all the plastic in the US is recycled, so most of those plastic bottles end up in landfills, with some even making their way to our oceans. 

With Jele tablets, you can feel great about giving your kids a delicious way to get healthy vitamins and electrolytes while helping the planet, too!

The Impact

A product like Jele, formulated for kids, is long overdue. Kids are getting too much sugar and sodium in their diets already, so we believe they shouldn't get overloaded with even more in the sports drinks they consume. Parents want their kids to drink more water, but it's tough because kids' taste buds have become conditioned to like salty, sugary foods and drinks. As kids grow into adulthood, their metabolism slows and they exercise less, but they are left with the same taste for salty, sugary foods. A lack of exercise and an unhealthy diet in adulthood can lead to a whole host of medical issues like high blood pressure, heart disease and even Type 2 Diabetes. 

During development, people asked "Why don't you just make a drink out of it so you don't have to use the tablet?" The answer was always the same - the tablet is part of the solution! What's easier - giving your kid a tube of 10 tablets to throw in their backpack or sports bag for use whenever they need it, or trying to remember "Did I put a drink in their bag today?" 

And finally, we have this plastic problem. Only 25% of the plastic in the US gets recycled, despite our concerted efforts of recycling at home. Some countries that used to accept plastic waste from the US (presumably headed to recycling facilities, but who really knows) are not accepting our plastic waste anymore, so a lot of it is heading to our landfills. The easiest way to ease our recycling burden is to manufacture and use less stuff in the first place.

Our goal at Jele is to empower our kids to take control of their health at an early age. To learn about what they are putting in their bodies and not get addicted to salty, sugary foods and drinks so they can avoid chronic health problems in the future. We hope you'll support us in this effort and help us bring Jele to as many kids as we can possibly reach. 

Thank you,

Jeff & Levi

story:
OUR STORY

Foodstiks was created in direct response to the growing plastic waste epidemic, both in the US and worldwide. Every year a staggering 60 Billion pieces of plastic disposable cutlery is used in the US alone. That is 100 Million pieces per day. An item that is used only for a couple minutes, but that can take up to 1,000 years to degrade.

Did you know that only about 9% of plastics get recycled. Almost 80% of all plastics ends up in landfills or the natural environment where it harms wildlife. Every year 1 Million seabirds and 100,000 marine mammals die from plastic in our Oceans.

3 years ago my husband Jim and I decided that we wanted to do something about that. We started changing our habits and drastically reduced using plastics. But we quickly realized that if we want to avoid to have more plastic in our Oceans than fish, we need to start thinking about alternatives to single use plastic.

We have always been working with wood and cherish its versatility. Few materials are more natural and more sustainable. The idea of wood disposable cutlery was born.

Our mission exceeds making a quality product. This is about a lifestyle, about making better choices and about making an impact.

 

What You Get

  • First of all you get the good vibes that come with the satisfaction that you are among the many eco-warriors that are making better choices to save the planet....
  • ...and of course the perks, depending on your level of much needed funds.

 

The Impact

Good intentions are great, but without good alternatives our society will not be able to adapt quickly enough to stop the devastating impacts of plastic pollution. Alternatives to single use plastic need to be made available to everyone who needs and desires them. And they need to be made available now!

By supporting our campaign you help us to make the difference that is needed to live in a world free of plastic pollution.

 

Risks & Challenges

Habits are hard to break. People are accustomed to looking for plastic disposables. By supporting our campaign, you help us spread the message that  1. alternatives are available and 2. it is worthwhile making an effort.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out! Share this campaign with family, friends, co-workers, co-volunteers and anybody who cares about the environment. 
  • Follow us on social media. Click here for: FACEBOOK or INSTAGRAM
  • Talk to your local food establishments about how they can reduce their footprint by looking for alternatives to single use plastics or handing out only on demand.
  • Don't take disposable plastic cutlery unnecessarily e.g. let the restaurant know you do not need it when ordering take out or delivery. 
  • Support beach, waterway and cleanup that collect plastic before it can get out to sea.

 

 

Say Goodbye to Plastic Today!

story:
About Us

Tired of all the hassles of making a cocktail at home?  The confusion of knowing the best recipes, the stress of having the right mixers on hand and the dread of cleaning up the mess and all the half-used bottles left over?  Problem solved - we have the perfect solution!

Bibo Barmaid, the first to market single-serve cocktail system, makes mixed drink consumption easy and convenient without the hassles of multiple mixers and dozens of big bottles. Consumers, who in the past could not be bothered with ‘the full bar’ and the fuss that entails, can now enjoy perfectly created mixed drinks – in just 20 seconds.  “Bibo”, pronounced Bee-bo, is Latin for ‘to drink’ and represents a massive behavior change in the liquor industry- both at home and in hospitality.

The 3-way system, (the appliance, the liquor and mixer pouches), empowers consumers to enjoy the entertainment and ease of use bestowed by the Bibo, a self-serve bartender -whether at home or in a hotel, a private jet or stadium box.  Featured on ABC News, CBS, ASOTV and voted as one of the Top 5 Kitchen Gadgets of the Future by Architectural Digest, Bibo is positioned to be a true category disruptor!

 

Bibo Barmaid System

Bibo is a three-part system with an easy learning curve for consumers. The beauty of this system approach is that consumers already understand how to ‘create’ their hot-served drinks via a systemized approach in a single-serve manner, (e.g. Keurig, Nespresso). Our three-part system includes:

 

Bibo Barmaid Dispenser: An engineered and patent pending machine that uniquely creates an excellent cocktail every time. It is the core of the system and is a stylish feature for kitchen counter tops. A smart, self-serve cocktail machine that allows consumers to create expertly crafted mixed drinks with the touch of a button.  Let Bibo do the bartending for you!

 

Bibo-Alcohol Pouches:  Our licensing partner, award-winning Claremont Distilled Spirits, has just recently launched liquor pouches for the revolutionary Bibo system rounding off our system and simplifying the experience! Their 50 ml alcohol pouches are available in liquor stores nationwide in the following 4 flavors:

  • Claremont Vodka              
  • Tracks & Rails Whiskey
  • Tilted Dog Dark Rum
  • Rosalita La Artista, Agave Distilled Spirit

Use one of our pouches  or your own favorite liquor brand with our cocktail shaker and shot glass (shown below) that are included with each Bibo Barmaid System. The shot glass is measured precisely to 50 ml so the drink is perfect every time!

Bibo-Cocktail Mixers: Perfectly created mixes available in single-serve mixer pouches that include juices and natural flavoring that create the best tasting drinks ever.  Bibo’s current line consists of 6 delicious flavors including Cucumber Melon Martini, Margarita, Mai Tai, Appletini, Rum Punch and Tangerine Paloma- a flavor for every taste!

And, our 3 NEW cocktail flavors are ready to launch- Whiskey Sour, Moscow Mule and John Daly.

Bibo Barmaid Features & Specs

  • Makes the perfect drink in less than 20 seconds with an easy to use system.  
  • LCD Panel and buttons give instructions for ease of use.  
  • Small counter-top profile for easy storage and light weight so you can take with you for tailgating or in your RV or boat.
  • There are two easy ways to clean the Bibo Barmaid: 1) rinse between drinks so there is no flavor residual from drink to drink; 2) after use, just pop out the handle/blade assembly and rinse that unit in warm soapy water for complete cleaning.

 

How it Works

 

 

Making a Bibo Cocktail is as easy as could be:  

1) Set up: Fill water reservoir, plug in, turn power on, place several ice cubes into your glass, and place glass on drip tray.

2) Drink Selection: Pick a drink type and insert the cocktail mixer pouch into the barmaid,

3) Add the alcohol pouch, as indicated on the cocktail mixer pouch or,  if using your own brand of alcohol, add alcohol shot when you add ice cubes.

4) Pull the handle down and press mix: out pours the perfect drink in about 20 seconds! 

 

Our Journey

Debra Walker is the inventor and entrepreneur behind the Bibo Barmaid system. Her expertise includes marketing and front end innovation with a focus on products that provide solutions for women. The idea was born when two of Deb's friends, both moms of young children, wanted a better way to make great cocktails at home.  With the popularity of single- serve, both coffee and soda offer lots of single-serve options, the time was ripe for a single-serve solution for cocktails.  

The key to any businesses success is having the right product; but more importantly lining up the supply chain puzzle pieces. Our team has established a solid foundation in building strong manufacturing partners from China to the shores of the United States.  Bibo has also worked with top engineers and designers to bring the best quality and easy-to-use single-serve cocktail maker in this emerging category. We strive to offer the best tasting drinks in the market and we partnered with Givaudan, the top flavor development company in the world, to realize that goal. 

We have received great consumer feedback including, "Right Price", "Love the flavor options", "Fits nicely on the counter", and most importantly - and consistently, "I love the taste!"  Our consumer testing has given us confidence that Bibo is on the path to be the leader in the single-serve market. 

 

 

Bibo Barmaid Team

Deb Walker

Debra Walker, inventor of Bibo Barmaid, has 25+ years of experience across multi-faceted positions in brand development and brand transformation, new business development and innovation. Deb's strong baseline general management capabilities coupled with consumer-focused methodologies has helped to build brands, transform categories, create unique growth platforms and develop winning go-to-market strategies. Success to Debra means making this company soar -- while at the same time creating a stream of funding for her non-profit endeavors to help children ages 11 - 22 who suffer challenges from Asperger's syndrome.

Carole Piccirillo

Carole joins the Bibo team with over 35 years of experience in all phases of operations, product development, marketing and sales. Carole has acted as National Accounts Executive for both mid-cap and Fortune 500 companies. Carole is adept at partnering with major retailers to develop products and programs to fit their specific needs, building long-term relationships and profitable growth. She will be responsible for sales strategy and execution as well as overseas operations.

Steve Schlesinger

Angel investor Steve Schlesinger is the majority owner of Schlesinger Associates, a global marketing research firm. He is the CEO of Schlesinger, an entrepreneur, angel investor and venture capitalist. Steve has been a key investor and strategic contributor to Bibo's launch.

Lorri Cooper

Lorri Cooper is a mechanical engineer and patent attorney and has had an integral role in designing and protecting the Bibo Barmaid system. Lorri has drafted and filed over 6 patent applications on behalf of Bibo.

Doug Melville

Doug Melville, co-founder of Design Innovation, Inc. has over thirty years’ experience in product design and development - and has been the key designer for Bibo Barmaid. He has his BFA in Industrial Design from the Rhode Island School of Design. Doug’s career as an industrial designer spans electronic and computer products, medical equipment, and toys. Doug has received over 30 U.S. mechanical patents and his concept sketches are included in the permanent archives of the Smithsonian Institute.

 

 

Final message from Bibo Barmaid

We're excited to continue expanding our line to revolutionize how people enjoy cocktails at home. The production for metallic silver is about to commence and our current and new cocktails taste amazing! All we need now is your contributions to kick start production and fund our new Bibo products.    

We have all the plans in place to deliver your product at the arranged timeline. Our factory has the capacity to produce Bibo machines to meet the expected demand and we are confident that we will be able to ship your order to meet our commitment to you.    

You can be assured that we continue to work exceptionally hard to ensure you are delighted with the bibo products and brand.  And, we are committed to top-notch quality in our products and customer service. Please support our campaign and check out the amazing Perks available.
story_txt:
About UsTired of all the hassles of making a cocktail at home?  The confusion of knowing the best recipes, the stress of having the right mixers on hand and the dread of cleaning up the mess and all the half-used bottles left over?  Problem solved - we have the perfect solution!Bibo Barmaid, the first to market single-serve cocktail system, makes mixed drink consumption easy and convenient without the hassles of multiple mixers and dozens of big bottles. Consumers, who in the past could not be bothered with ‘the full bar’ and the fuss that entails, can now enjoy perfectly created mixed drinks – in just 20 seconds.  “Bibo”, pronounced Bee-bo, is Latin for ‘to drink’ and represents a massive behavior change in the liquor industry- both at home and in hospitality.The 3-way system, (the appliance, the liquor and mixer pouches), empowers consumers to enjoy the entertainment and ease of use bestowed by the Bibo, a self-serve bartender -whether at home or in a hotel, a private jet or stadium box.  Featured on ABC News, CBS, ASOTV and voted as one of the Top 5 Kitchen Gadgets of the Future by Architectural Digest, Bibo is positioned to be a true category disruptor! Bibo Barmaid SystemBibo is a three-part system with an easy learning curve for consumers. The beauty of this system approach is that consumers already understand how to ‘create’ their hot-served drinks via a systemized approach in a single-serve manner, (e.g. Keurig, Nespresso). Our three-part system includes: Bibo Barmaid Dispenser: An engineered and patent pending machine that uniquely creates an excellent cocktail every time. It is the core of the system and is a stylish feature for kitchen counter tops. A smart, self-serve cocktail machine that allows consumers to create expertly crafted mixed drinks with the touch of a button.  Let Bibo do the bartending for you! Bibo-Alcohol Pouches:  Our licensing partner, award-winning Claremont Distilled Spirits, has just recently launched liquor pouches for the revolutionary Bibo system rounding off our system and simplifying the experience! Their 50 ml alcohol pouches are available in liquor stores nationwide in the following 4 flavors:
Claremont Vodka              
Tracks & Rails Whiskey
Tilted Dog Dark Rum
Rosalita La Artista, Agave Distilled Spirit 

Use one of our pouches  or your own favorite liquor brand with our cocktail shaker and shot glass (shown below) that are included with each Bibo Barmaid System. The shot glass is measured precisely to 50 ml so the drink is perfect every time!Bibo-Cocktail Mixers: Perfectly created mixes available in single-serve mixer pouches that include juices and natural flavoring that create the best tasting drinks ever.  Bibo’s current line consists of 6 delicious flavors including Cucumber Melon Martini, Margarita, Mai Tai, Appletini, Rum Punch and Tangerine Paloma- a flavor for every taste!And, our 3 NEW cocktail flavors are ready to launch- Whiskey Sour, Moscow Mule and John Daly.
Bibo Barmaid Features & Specs

Makes the perfect drink in less than 20 seconds with an easy to use system.  
LCD Panel and buttons give instructions for ease of use.  
Small counter-top profile for easy storage and light weight so you can take with you for tailgating or in your RV or boat.
There are two easy ways to clean the Bibo Barmaid: 1) rinse between drinks so there is no flavor residual from drink to drink; 2) after use, just pop out the handle/blade assembly and rinse that unit in warm soapy water for complete cleaning.
 How it Works  Making a Bibo Cocktail is as easy as could be:  1) Set up: Fill water reservoir, plug in, turn power on, place several ice cubes into your glass, and place glass on drip tray.2) Drink Selection: Pick a drink type and insert the cocktail mixer pouch into the barmaid,3) Add the alcohol pouch, as indicated on the cocktail mixer pouch or,  if using your own brand of alcohol, add alcohol shot when you add ice cubes.4) Pull the handle down and press mix: out pours the perfect drink in about 20 seconds!  Our JourneyDebra Walker is the inventor and entrepreneur behind the Bibo Barmaid system. Her expertise includes marketing and front end innovation with a focus on products that provide solutions for women. The idea was born when two of Deb's friends, both moms of young children, wanted a better way to make great cocktails at home.  With the popularity of single- serve, both coffee and soda offer lots of single-serve options, the time was ripe for a single-serve solution for cocktails.  The key to any businesses success is having the right product; but more importantly lining up the supply chain puzzle pieces. Our team has established a solid foundation in building strong manufacturing partners from China to the shores of the United States.  Bibo has also worked with top engineers and designers to bring the best quality and easy-to-use single-serve cocktail maker in this emerging category. We strive to offer the best tasting drinks in the market and we partnered with Givaudan, the top flavor development company in the world, to realize that goal. We have received great consumer feedback including, "Right Price", "Love the flavor options", "Fits nicely on the counter", and most importantly - and consistently, "I love the taste!"  Our consumer testing has given us confidence that Bibo is on the path to be the leader in the single-serve market.   Bibo Barmaid TeamDeb WalkerDebra Walker, inventor of Bibo Barmaid, has 25+ years of experience across multi-faceted positions in brand development and brand transformation, new business development and innovation. Deb's strong baseline general management capabilities coupled with consumer-focused methodologies has helped to build brands, transform categories, create unique growth platforms and develop winning go-to-market strategies. Success to Debra means making this company soar -- while at the same time creating a stream of funding for her non-profit endeavors to help children ages 11 - 22 who suffer challenges from Asperger's syndrome.Carole PiccirilloCarole joins the Bibo team with over 35 years of experience in all phases of operations, product development, marketing and sales. Carole has acted as National Accounts Executive for both mid-cap and Fortune 500 companies. Carole is adept at partnering with major retailers to develop products and programs to fit their specific needs, building long-term relationships and profitable growth. She will be responsible for sales strategy and execution as well as overseas operations.Steve SchlesingerAngel investor Steve Schlesinger is the majority owner of Schlesinger Associates, a global marketing research firm. He is the CEO of Schlesinger, an entrepreneur, angel investor and venture capitalist. Steve has been a key investor and strategic contributor to Bibo's launch.Lorri CooperLorri Cooper is a mechanical engineer and patent attorney and has had an integral role in designing and protecting the Bibo Barmaid system. Lorri has drafted and filed over 6 patent applications on behalf of Bibo.Doug MelvilleDoug Melville, co-founder of Design Innovation, Inc. has over thirty years’ experience in product design and development - and has been the key designer for Bibo Barmaid. He has his BFA in Industrial Design from the Rhode Island School of Design. Doug’s career as an industrial designer spans electronic and computer products, medical equipment, and toys. Doug has received over 30 U.S. mechanical patents and his concept sketches are included in the permanent archives of the Smithsonian Institute.  Final message from Bibo BarmaidWe're excited to continue expanding our line to revolutionize how people enjoy cocktails at home. The production for metallic silver is about to commence and our current and new cocktails taste amazing! All we need now is your contributions to kick start production and fund our new Bibo products.    We have all the plans in place to deliver your product at the arranged timeline. Our factory has the capacity to produce Bibo machines to meet the expected demand and we are confident that we will be able to ship your order to meet our commitment to you.    You can be assured that we continue to work exceptionally hard to ensure you are delighted with the bibo products and brand.  And, we are committed to top-notch quality in our products and customer service. Please support our campaign and check out the amazing Perks available.

story:
Salut, 

(texte en Français plus bas)

We are Midnight Poutine! For those who never heard of us, we're a Burning Man food camp from the french speaking province of Canada called Québec.  Since 2009, we've been driving 10 000 km (6 200 miles) to Black Rock City, NV, to serve poutines to very hungry and eager burners at -surprise - midnight!

But what's poutine?  It's a traditional Québecois comfort food usually (but not always) eaten after a night of drinking. It’s made from french fries and cheese curds (what is called in Quebecois "cheese droppings "). The whole thing covered with thick brown sauce from ancient family recipes.  After a full day of drinking and partying on the playa this simple dish will blow you away!

Last year, 2000 hungry burners got a taste of Midnight Poutine. It's a party every night with Québecois music, a burn barrel, sexy people, line-ups around the block, an open-mic and burlesque stage to entertain the line-up and, of course, poutine! We don't want to leave anybody hungry at BRC :)  

We need your contributions for :

Cheese curds : Hell yeah, we use REAL cheese curds!  Without cheese we would just have fries and sauce, and we all know how boring that would be.  And it turns out that cheese curds are our biggest expense!!!

The other Ingredients : This include potatoes, gravy,  and oil and there's a lot propane to feed our trusty 6 fryers.

The other Logistics : It takes a lot to set up a food camp, make eating areas, an open-mic stage and decorations, not to mention getting all this stuff to Burning Man from Montreal and renting a storage locker year-round in Reno, NV, for all our other stuff.  'nuff said.  

It cost about 5000$ to serve about 2000 poutines and this excludes our camp's expenses. Some of the financing is done through fundraising events and by us. So that means ALL the money you contribute goes toward running the poutine kitchen! The more money we get, the more poutines we have the pleasure to serve, it's that simple.

Please help us feed our fellow burners in 2019 by funding the best late-night party food camp on the playa.  Thank you all!

*** UPDATE *** (Aug. 1st)

Thanks to you all we have reached our funding goal! Woo-hoo!! But there are still 5 days left, so if we can reach $4000 USD (our new extended goal), we shall be able to offer you poutine with BACON and cold draft BEER on the playa!! Isn't that awesome?  :-)

 

Bonjour à tous,

Nous sommes Midnight Poutine,  un camp de Montréal qui depuis 2009 parcourt 10 000 km aller-retour pour se rendre a Burning Man au Nevada. Tous les soirs à minuit sur la "playa", nous offrons de la poutine à nos compatriotes festivaliers (ou "burners").

Qu’est-ce que la poutine? Il s’agit d’un plat typiquement québécois composé de patates frites et de fromage en grain, communément appelé "crottes de fromage", le tout nappé d’une sauce dont la recette est un secret familial bien gardé.  Après une journée complète de fête et de boisson, le goût de nos poutines va faire littéralement "capoter" tous les burners.

L’an passé, nous avons offert 2000 poutines à des burners affamés qui étaient prêt à attendre des heures pour goûter à notre petit plat typique de fin-de-brosse.  Ça devient une fête improvisée a tous les soirs avec de la grosse musique Québécoise, du beau monde sexy, un baril de feu, une immense file d'attente, une scène ouverte ou les gens peuvent monter et divertir ceux qui attendent en ligne avec des performances de musique, burlesque, etc. et, bien sûr, d'la poutiiiiiiiine!

Nous avons besoin de vos contributions pour : 

Les crottes de fromage : Eh oui, le fromage est sans contredit notre dépense la plus coûteuse mais sans fromage ça ne serait qu’une frite-sauce et on sait bien que c’est plate une frite-sauce.

Les autres ingrédients : Cela inclut les patates, la sauce, l’huile et aussi le gaz propane pour alimenter nos 6 friteuses adorées.

Les autres logistiques : À chaque année, nous devons construire notre camp, nos deux cuisines (publique et privée),  la scène "open-mic and burlesque stage" sans compter le transport de notre matériel en camion à partir de Montréal jusqu’à la playa et la location à l'année d'un espace d'entreposage pour le reste de notre stock à Reno, NV. Soyez certains que tout l'argent ramassé servira uniquement aux besoins culinaires de Midnight Poutine.

Il nous en coûte environ 5000$ pour servir 2000 poutines et ceci exclut les dépenses de notre campement. Une bonne partie de notre financement est faite grâce à des événements locaux en plus de nos propres contributions. Ainsi, TOUTES les sommes que nous collecterons dans cette campagne serviront uniquement à financer la cuisine.  Plus nous amasserons d'argent, plus de poutines nous aurons le plaisir de servir sur la playa. C'est aussi simple que ça.
 

Nous vous remercions de bien vouloir nous aider à répéter l’expérience encore une fois cette année. C'est grâce à vous que Midnight Poutine devient un lieu incontournable pour commencer sa soirée à Burning Man 2019. Un gros merci à tous!! 

*** MISE-À-JOUR *** (1ier Aout)

Grâce à vous nous avons atteint notre objectif de financement! Hoorah!! Mais il reste encore 5 jours à notre campagne, donc si on peut atteindre $4000 USD (notre nouvel objectif), nous serons en mesure de vous offrir de la poutine avec BACON et de la BIÈRE en fût sur la playa!! C'est-tu pas cool ça?  :-)

story:
QUICK UPDATE!

Yes, we met our goal (YAY) but we also had a few unexpected expenses crop up during our last build (we got some bald tires, broken LNT tools, and we needed MOAR WOOD because who doesn't love wood?).

So please, buy some booty and help us out <3

 

EGGS Bar History

Once upon a time, in that place of dust, dreams and warm whiskey a bar was born. Our watering hole at center camp plaza where everyone knows your name or doesn't question the one your gave them is always closed; but surprisingly full of burners from all walks of playa including YOU! It’s the best little bar on playa, 33 years running. 

Running a bar ain’t easy tho' first there is all the building, then the drinking, plus the friend making its a lot of work!

The current Eggs Bar was built for Burning Man 2016 from a lift of mistakenly ordered 2x3s and more growlers of Drakes than I can legally admit. 

After 3 years of HEAVY use it seriously needed some love. This year we have rebuilt much of the bar so that it has more structural integrity than popsicle sticks and deck screws and will last for more burns than you say you have left in ya.

 

You love swag, we love swag, get EGGS Bar Swag!

For 2019 you will be handsomely rewarded for supporting your drinking habit with the rare opportunity to rep your favorite dusty watering hole with our awesome swag

Parent teacher conference? Throw on a EGGS Bar t-shirt.

Jumpsuit looking a lil normal? Slap a patch on it.

Going somewhere in the bay in July? Bundle up in a hoodie.

Opening beer? Do it like a pro with a bar key!

Overall Cost:

We love that you keep grabbin' our swag and moving us closer and closer to a life long commitment to playa! Shit happens though, which we found out during a recent build weekend. 

Our tires are bald! If you know anything about anything, you know that is NOT eggtastic. We'll have to buy some new tires after this trip out to the dust, so please help us stay safe on the road and deliver all of our precious bar pieces and booze in...one piece!

Our operating budget for the bar this year is now $12,000! Every little bit helps us cover our costs.  The more we raise, the more booze we buy, the better our sound is, and the less traffic accidents there are. Go on! Grab some sweet EGGS Bar gear and help us on our way.

  • $3300 Transportation and Maintenance
  • $1800 Year Round Storage
  • $3000 Bar improvements 
  • $3000 Booze for YOU!

 

Gratitude! 

From the bottom of our hearts and the soles of our crusty boots THANK YOU!
We love bringing the bar to playa and creating a special space for friends old and new to connect, celebrate life, trade lies and maybe lose a shoe. We love ya! See you out there space cowboy.

story:
Our Story

We're John and Dave and we currently own and operate Original Local Lager. We're two great friends that wanted nothing more than to do our own thing and get involved in the beer industry! We're craft beer geeks who saw that there was no simple, easy to recognize lager for Ottawa and the region to call its own.

Why

  • This is our first offering of merchandise!
  • Friends, supporters and restaurants have all asked about t-shirts and hats!
  • This is a great way to jump start that process!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we're doing with this fundraiser:

  • We're raising money ahead of time to fund getting some awesome merch to you!
  • You'll be the first to wear cool Original Local Lager swag around town and help us promote our brand
  • This will help us understand what the best styles of clothing for us to stock going forward are!
  • If we don't reach our goal, no problem! You still get what was promised to you!
  • If we do reach our goal, we're gonna have an awesome free party for everyone who donated!

The Impact

  • We're trying to fund getting some merch available more permanently
  • We're already at 50+ bars, restaurants and grocery stores but want to grow our brand and become more recognizable!
  • Be a part of the Local beer community with us!

Risks & Challenges

None! Haha, shirts and hats might take a little time to ship, but otherwise this is a safe campaign!

 

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

If you have any questions about sizing, just ask at info@localbeers.ca.

If you have any questions about sizing, just ask at info@localbeers.ca.

story:
Our Story & Mission 

Bare Bones Coffee is a two person team of Mina Cahue and Frankie Adriano. We, like many other coffee professionals, ended up in this industry by accident. We picked up jobs as baristas on a whim and we've been obsessed with coffee ever since. We fell in love with the creative outlet that coffee provided us and the environment of cafes, but we always wanted something more. We wanted to keep challenging ourselves and the people that worked with us. We knew the only way we could be content is if we created something that was entirely our own.

We established Bare Bones Coffee because we wanted to challenge the norms of how coffee can and should be served. We believe in keeping things simple, approachable, intentional, and graceful. Every movement and interaction should have a meaning behind it. 

We chose the name Bare Bones Coffee because it reflects our minimalist and earnest approach to our business. We will be operating as a bare-bones cafe as we carry around our compact espresso bar from place to place; we will also be featuring a slimmed down espresso based menu, Mexican and Asian inspired pastries, and a service style focused around being welcoming and hospitable. We hope you enjoy our coffee as much as we enjoy serving it.

Funding

All the funding for this campaign will be used for various things that we need to become operational. We're about 90% ready to get rolling and start serving the public, but we need a little bit more to get ourselves properly established.  These funds will go towards a countertop pitcher rinser, a plumb-in kit for our espresso machine, and a POS system. Any left over funds will be used for various operational costs (e.g. ingredients, disposables, etc).

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to post the link to our campaign and tell people you know about us. We'll be doing pop-ups in the downtown La Grange area so if you know anyone around there, let them know about our project! But the biggest favor you can do for us is when we pop up, come in and visit us for a cup of coffee and a chat so you can see what we're about in person.

-----------------------------

P.S. A huge thank you to everyone that has supported us, encouraged us, and advised us so far. Bare Bones Coffee wouldn't be possible without everyone's help. This company is as much an effort of yours as it is ours, and for that we are immensely grateful. 

Again, thank you!

story:
Hi there, Internet!

Thanks for stopping by our little page!

I'm Jim Bozic, and I'm hoping to be the proud owner of Rocky and Shem's Ice Cream Shoppe. My pups, Rocky and Shem, are the inspiration for all of this.

What we want to bring is a people and puppy friendly ice cream shop to South Minneapolis. Your generous donations will be going toward the cost of the additional equipment so we can provide our four-legged neighborhood friends with delicious homemade treats that they so desperately deserve.

We are looking at raising $10,000 to help cover the puppy aspect of our business. The cost of the refrigeration equipment is about $7,000 (includes the storage and displays for the puppy treats), and the outdoor kennel area which will run about $3,000. The outdoor kennel area is important for us as we want to provide a safe, inviting location for families to bring their puppies. And if we don't raise the entire amount, we will still be applying the money to the puppy portion of our business. It'll just take us longer to get there. But that will make the puppies sad. And nobody likes sad doggies, right?!

In return for your support, we want you to know that you will physically be a part of Rocky and Shem's. For every donation we receive, your name will be will be permanently painted in a border around our shop and given many thanks on our website. We want you to know that without you, we couldn't make this happen, and what better way than to etch you in as part of the Rocky and Shem Experience!

For those that our able to give more, we will also shower you with free ice cream and clothing, too. And for those that can give the most, we will dedicate an ice cream special in honor of your name! We will also post it online for all to see!

We plan to open the doors in April of 2013. We will be able to send out the perks starting in the middle of August.

So on to the other stuffs…

You might be saying to yourself, "well, that's great for pups, but what about for me?". And I have an answer! We will be bringing Bridgeman's Ice Cream back to South Minneapolis. See, our community is lacking a certain flair. There isn't really a neighborhood friendly place that people can sit and enjoy themselves. And that's what we want to do. Think of it as us giving back to the community!

So, there you have it in a nutshell! And if you don't have the means to help us meet our goal, you can still help us out. So, spread the word, like us on facebook, have a parade in our honor, share us on Indiegogo. But most importantly, just wish us luck on our tremendous journey!

Thanks for your time and support!
-Jim, Deb, Rocky, and Shem

 

*The free scoop perk is limited to in-store, once a week. This can also be transferrable to your favorite pooch!  :)

 

****UPDATE****

Thank you to all that have donated to us so far. We cetainly do appreciate it. But I also wanted to let everyone know that we've added a newsletter. Please sign up from rockyandshems.com!

story:
FROM KITCHEN TO TAP ROOM
10 years of homebrewing. Creating beers for the gatherings, holidays,
friends. Then brewing for the SBAC Golf Outing, Pitchfest,Edgewater Chamber
of Commerce Holiday Party, and many special nights for the Factory Theater.
From home to outings to a new home for outings, this is the story of
Chuck Patella and Howard Street Brewing Company.
 
While sitting on a bar stool at the Rock Bottom Brewery in Chicago, IL, my buddy turned to me and said that he just started homebrewing. I had no idea what that meant, but I wanted to know more. We talked a lot about the intricacies of beer.  We talked about the process.  We talked about flavor profile.  We talked about all the different breweries in Chicago and Michigan.  I was infatuated with the process and the culture.  After I walked out of the bar that night, all I wanted to do was make beer. I dedicated myself to the study of beer: I visited breweries, listened intently to brewers when they spoke about their craft, read all the books I could find, and finally started creating recipes. After 10 years of brewing, events, and valuable feedback, I am finally ready to take beer making to the next level. I am opening a 1 Barrel tap room, Howard Street Brewing Company, on the northern edge of Rogers Park.
 
The First Beer:
The first beer I ever made was an Irish Red Ale. It was a malt extract kit that came with dry yeast. It’s easily the worst beer I have ever made. To my credit, I've always taken sanitation seriously, so I don't think there was a bacterial infection. What it lacked in flavor, which was everything, it made up for in cleanliness. I had made very sanitary beer-flavored water. When the bottles started exploding in my closet from over carbonation, I realized I had some things to think about.
 
Current Beers:
fermentation room (aka utility closet in basement)
I've come a long way since my almost breakup from my then-girlfriend-now-loving-wife. When we both woke up screaming due to the sound of an exploding bottle (as I mention in the video, she is truly a saint), I wasn’t sure how much further she would go. Lucky for me, we just celebrated our 10-year wedding anniversary! Things are much safer now, both for the marriage and the bottles. I regularly brew my own all-grain recipes and kegging at home. I have taken over a large section of
the house with brewing equipment, and we have been sleeping peacefully for years. Most of the beers I make are more about flavor and sessionability than heavy hops and high ABV. I love those beers, don’t get me wrong, but there are so many styles out there that breweries are just recently discovering and experiment with. It’s an exciting time to be both a craft brewer and a beer drinker. Howard Street Brewing Company’s flagship beers are going to be a Pale Ale, a Red RyePA, a Saison, a Stout, and a Pilsner. These are the recipes that I have been focused on to really perfect the balance between the malt, yeast, and hops while capturing the style and essence of each beer.
 
Where The Money Goes
Back in March, I did something crazy. I drove from Chicago to Albuquerque, New Mexico over 4 days to pick up a 1 BBL brew kettle, mash tun, liquor tank, burners, and some other brewing gear. I didn’t have any funding yet,but I knew I was going to be opening a brewery within the next 2 years. SoI bought the equipment without knowing when or where I would use it. I am very happy to say this will be installed on Howard Street. Also, check out Bombs Away and La Cumbre if you are ever in New Mexico. Wonderful people and delicious beers.

We have raised the bulk of the money we will need for our startup costs, including licenses, brite tanks, the bar, and refrigeration. The money from this
1 BBL Mashtun, Hot Liquor Tank, and Kettle.
For scale: a 6 year old who dabs
campaign will be used towards the purchase of five 1 barrel jacketed conical fermentation tanks. These tanks will be also be fitted with temperature control, so the sky's the limit on the types of beer styles we can make!
 
Tap Room Details
Our 26 seat tap room initial hours of operations will be:
Monday – Wednesday - closed
Thursday: 4pm – 11pm
Friday: 4pm – 12am
Saturday: 12pm – 12am
Sunday: 12pm – 8pm
 
Wedding Packages
Packages include:
  • 1 Hour Beer Consultation at Brewery and samples of beer
  • 1 Keg
  • Brew day for up to 6 individuals with up to 3 pints of beers each
  • Custom 6 pack carrier, Custom Beer Bottles, and Custom Bottle Caps
  • Delivery of Kegs and Six Packs to venue
  • Pick up of Keg
Hosted Pop Up Events
During the summer, we will have an annual crawfish boil and BBQ Smoke Out. Once every quarter, we will host a pop-up dining event in the space. We will partner with local chefs, foodies, and bloggers to create a night of beer paired with delicious food.
 
Branding
We are currently working with our marketing team on our logo and branding. We'll show it off once it's ready!
 
Other Ways To Help
Share and spread the word! Social media, email, semaphore flags...whatever you can do to tell everyone you know about us. We are so excited to bring Howard Street Brewing Company to Rogers Park, and every little bit helps! Thank you so very much for taking a look at our campaign. Cheers!

Brew day for up to 6 individuals with up to 3 pints of beers each
Custom 6 pack carrier, Custom Beer Bottles, and Custom Bottle Caps
Delivery of Kegs and Six Packs to venue
Pick up of Keg

Hosted Pop Up Events

story:
The pace and stress of our modern lifestyles leave us little time to consider our aging bodies and minds, often times hastening degenerative aging.  Degenerative aging affects us all, with signs such as wrinkles, joint pain, muscle deterioration, and slowing cognitive function, usually beginning to develop in our early to mid-30’s. Luckily, there are proven solutions to slow and healthily support the aging process.

Foundationally, we know that diet and exercise are two primary actions to take to slow degenerative aging.  But to fully optimize our minds and bodies as we age, we believe that taking proven supplements will protect and support our bodies in ways we may not get from diet and exercise alone.  We also believe that drinking coffee every day just makes life better!

This is why we created AWAKN, an Instant collagen Coffee infused with MCT oil designed to support and optimize our aging bodies.  

Using the latest research and working with leading food scientists, we developed the perfect cup of instant collagen coffee with simple ingredients that support anti-aging and help you optimize your day from anywhere.

It's not just about the ingredients though, it tastes incredible!  We've sourced a delicious premium organic instant coffee, so our collagen coffee tastes like a perfectly balanced and smooth cup of coffee with a hint of creaminess and a slight crema on top when stirred.  We do not add any flavorings or sweeteners, allowing the pure coffee flavors and aromas to unfold. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Collagen Protein

Collagen is a leading beauty and anti-aging supplement and one of the most abundant proteins found in our bodies. It’s a crucial component to optimize and build strength, cohesion, and elasticity in joints, tendons, muscles, and skin.  

Modern diets, stress and aging all contribute to a decrease of collagen, causing a deficit in the collagen needs of our bodies.  This collagen deficit can lead to visible aging and degenerative signs on and in the body such as joint pain, muscle loss, wrinkles, loss of skin elasticity, brittle nails and hair.

Fortunately, collagen CAN be supplemented to meet our bodies needs and help restore and strengthen our skin, nails, hair, joints, and muscles.

Extensive clinical research has been done on collagen, below are some of the documented benefits:

  • Joint health and repair (1, 2)
  • Muscle and connective tissue health and repair (3, 4, 5)
  • Bone health (6, 7)
  • Skin, hair and nail health (8, 9)
  • Gut health improvement (10)

 

MCT Oil

MCT’s (medium chain triglycerides) are saturated fatty acids derived from the fat in coconuts. Due to public misinformation about saturated fats, these essential fatty acids are often missing from our western diet.

As described by Medical News Today  “MCTs are found in coconut oil and are processed by the body in a different way to long-chain fatty acids. Unlike other fats, they go straight from the gut to the liver. From here, they are used as a source of energy or turned into ketones.  Ketones are substances produced when the liver breaks down a lot of fat, and they can be used by the brain for energy instead of glucose or sugar. As the calories in MCTs are used straight away, they are less likely to be stored as fat. This principle is the basis of the ketogenic diet, which many people believe is an effective way to lose weight.”

MCT oil is an excellent way to optimize our brains with energy by providing a steady source of fatty acids.  Not only do MCT’s supply our brains with energy but they also support our brains cognitive function as we age (1, 1.5).

Along with optimizing our brains, MCT research documents these amazing benefits:

  1. Support gut health and digestion (2, 3)
  2. Protects the heart (4)
  3. Increased athletic endurance (5)
  4. Supports weight loss and improves blood sugar levels (6, 7, 8)
  5. Antimicrobial properties (9, 10)

 

Coffee (1)

There is tons of research available stating all the benefits of coffee, but we'll leave it at

COFFEE = HAPPINESS

 

 

 

 

Below is the render of our package design.  We are still in the process of making some final edits to the copy and we will share the final design of the packets when completed.

 

 

 

 

 

Aging affects everyone, whether you’re a mom, dad, executive, entrepreneur or athlete, you’re going to get older.  Our vision is to create a community and specialized products that can both educate and support long and active health spans. We want you to have the functionality to play with your kids, hike mountains, surf big waves, manage all day meetings and travel to exotic destinations without being limited by age.

We have a grand vision, and we are starting with a product designed for everyone.  With your support and trust, we want to start our journey with you, by producing a product that you can use every day to optimize your health span.

We've developed the formula, sourced the ingredients and designed the packaging.  Now we need your help to produce the first batch of AWAKN. 

Your investment in the first production run will get us off the ground and make you the first to experience this amazing collagen coffee, helping you start down a path to optimize your health span.

 

  • Thermo 3D ™ Double Wall Vacuum Insulation Technology
  • 18/8 Medical grade stainless steel doesn't transfer flavor & no metal aftertaste
  • Hardshell™ powder coat (colored tumblers)
  • Lid and cup are BPA free. Press-on lid prevents splashes and keeps drinks warm longer
  • Cup holder compatible
